intro: Chassalia javanica, commonly known as the Java chassalia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Chassalia javanica is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
